work.name: University of California, Los Angeles

work.name: Amazon
highlights: Applied causal inference methods, including regression discontinuity, to estimate customer delivery speed preferences within the Worldwide Grocery Stores business.
Wrote scripts to regularly re-estimate these parameters to evaluate the tradeoff of hiring more warehouse labor vs. losing orders due to longer promise times at specific locations and times of day.
Prepared and presented technical and non-technical reports to finance, operations, and science teams, effectively communicating insights to inform cross-functional decision-making.

work.name: University of California, Los Angeles
highlights: Processed 1.5 billion rows of voter registration data by implementing memory-efficient techniques, such as working with small samples, parallelizing preprocessing steps, and using dimensionality reduction methods like principal component analysis.
Developed an algorithm to follow registered voters over time by linking voter registration files with name, age, and address fuzzy matching.

In a separate project I collected and processed data on public transit agencies across the US. I performed regression analysis to examine the relationship between government funding, service quality, and ridership.
